Posts.Content: I spent 3 days there recently. They did tests and diagnostics for my advanced cancer. They have good qualified dr's with a integrative approach as well. Treating symptoms, mind body and spirit. You don't feel like your in a hospital. They did accept my insurance and a lot services are free such as accupucture.rekei, etc. Just a different atmosphere, the personnel are upbeat and positive as I am sure they are trained to do this. Let me know if you have any other specific questions, Warm regards
Posts.Title: Cancer Treament Centers of America

Posts.Content: This is an androgen receptor antagonist or an androgen deprivation therapy. A common name for this is Xtandi. I took this drug for about 4 months and it really din't drop my psa like the other drug you mentioned zytiga. These drugs are for metaatastic castration resistant prostate cancer. Basically when lupron does not work by itself and they need to assist with these drugs. I had no side effects to mention. Best to your Dad ,Ken Originally Posted by HighlanderCFH Welcome to the Prostate Cancer forum, Coyote, and thanks to Di for moving you over here. I'm not well versed in the type of treatment your father is having, but lots of others here will be. So stay tuned as they come in with their experiences, thoughts & advice. Wishing the best for your dad, Chuck
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed with prostate cancer in oct. 2010.Gleason 4+3 with tertiary 5 5. Radical prostatectomy in dec 2010. april 2011 salvage radiation to right seminal vesicle. psa undectable 1 year. Rose to1.3 march 2011. started Firmagon 6/29/11 then Lupron 8/18/2012 .psa increase 3.2 2013. met right ischium on scan. also nodal mass received xrt. provenge with last infusion 2/14/2013. casodex added minimal response. zytiga 3/13 to 2/14. rising again xtandi 1/21/14 thru 4/1/14 no help. xrt to bone lesion 2/20/2014, xrt to left 6th rib 4/25/14,dec 2014. xofigo treatments 5/8/14 til 11/2014. rising psa going to 20 started taxotere 11/2014 thru January 2015. psa went from 28 to 6. current psa 86,new spinal and rib mets
Posts.Title: My father and Xtandi (enzalutamide) post Zytiga

Posts.Content: I had mine spread to seminal vesicle and they did post op radiation
Posts.Title: Surgery complete and cancer had spread to seminal vesicle .

Posts.Content: Can anyone offer any suggestions on treatments. They might want to do different chemo(taxotere was used) radiated 5 times have 2 lymph mets and 4 rib and ischial met.I feel like a lab rat sometimes as I have done so many treatments. I am castration resistant - tried many adnrogen deprivation drugs. I am now at cross roads with staying course(doesnt last) or maybe going to ctoa and integrative therapies. I would be very appreciated for any suggestions.

Posts.Content: Has anyone heard of some of these alternative therapies such as Vitamin C infusions, Hypethermia,Sono dynamic... They are offered at Cancer treatments of America and other places overseas which have equipment that is not fad approved but has results. Ronald Reagan went to Germany to get his cancer treated. Thanks and best to all
Posts.Title: integrative therapies/alternative CTOA

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Jim215 A simple Google search will provide info that "Ronald Reagan went to Germany to get his cancer treated" has been thoroughly debunked. Conspiracy theories ("What the cancer industry doesn't want you to know!!") pop up everywhere but there is no place for them on this website. When people become desperate there is a tendency to grasp at straws but it serves no useful purpose and is detrimental to those who seek reliable answers via proven scientific modalities. By no means would I attempt to authenticate any of these theories. I am new to any cancer forum and was simply reaching out to people that might have investigated alternatives. I need empirical evidence as well. But I am 54 and have advanced stage 4 mcrpc past with more mets shown and psa quadrupled after chemo in 6 weeks. I WILL THINK OUTSIDE OF THE BOX. I have been given a very poor prognosis by Mayo and I want like many to add months and god willing years. I apologize for bringing this hot topic and if I do seek remedies else and are successful you will be the first one I will inform. Maybe you call this desperate and grasping at straws. I call it trying to keep hope and there just might be other answers.
Posts.Title: integrative therapies/alternative CTOA

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by ASAdvocate kennyk, Given your situation, I applaud your efforts to think outside the box, as conventional therapies do not offer you the hope that you need to strengthen your will to fight. I trust that the moderators and other posters will read this and allow you the slack to pursue subjects that are usually dismissed. For you, everything should be open to discussion. Good luck. e Thanks for the kind words. Actually I really didn't have any intention to promote any of this alt therapies or that it works etc.. It was just a random question. I do not want to be singled out as maybe it should be on a seperate topic. Believe me a numerous amount of people are seeking other ideas and hopefully are intelligent enough to draw their own conclusions. If people watched the 60 minute special last night they are actually using polio vaccine to treat a rare form of brain cancer and looking to treat other cancers. also there was a hbo special a month ago on similar topic. fda has approved in phase 1. MD anderson is testing a hyperthermia treatment in trials which is not conventional. I will not bring this up again and I thank you and all for assistance. Best, Kenny
Posts.Title: integrative therapies/alternative CTOA

Posts.Content: How dare you accuse me of the validity of my condition. Why would I ever come onto a cancer form? What do you need proof of my psa at 86 now and my scans showing all my mets,etc. I don't know who the ___ you think you are. I am on this forum for mutual support and education. I am now so reluctant to continue with this. I do not know how to put the history like you guys do on the bottom. I was never told how and didn't think it was essential. I am appalled by this. I know there are some good people I have dialogued with. Originally Posted by Michael F Prostate Forum Members: Have you already forgotten that Mr KennyK initiated a thread on 3/27 about himself to which many responded? It contained "0" details and some spurious descriptives that did not add up. I had and now have increased doubt of Mr KennyK's veracity! KennyK according to himself: - is 54 1/2 yo - was diagnosed at age 50 and then his PSA went Undetectable for a year!!!! From "undetectable" it skyrocketed to 39!!! (Yet never any mention of surgical intervention following diagnosis??? Nor a single peep about Gleason scores????) - has previously seen and has a follow up appointment with the "head of the dept" at University of Chicago. (IMHO, this MD has to be good! But I guess not good enough for kenny's twin???) To Mr KennyK: Send Highlander a private email with your contact # and Chuck will give you a call. To Highlander: If KennyK does not comply, remove ALL of his postings. MF

Posts.Content: I did taxotere chemo and it can shut down cancer but time varies. My psa went from 30 to 6 but now its higher. But these are extenders and of course we know not cures. But it can help as it did for me
Posts.Title: How much time did chemo buy you:

Posts.Content: I agree Steve. Taxotere did bring my psa down through the six cycles. I think I am going for an immunotherapy trial at u of c. They need to test tissue from prostate to see if I have tumor marker Which is needed to qualify. Have you looked into xofigo injections. I did this for mets. Radioactive isotope injections Let's keep up the fight. Best ken
Posts.Title: How much time did chemo buy you:

Posts.Content: Oh thanks Allen, I will be more descriptive and detailed: I started my chemo in october of 2014 and there were 6 cycles of taxotere administered to me 3 weeks apart. So the duration was a total of 18 weeks. Taxotere is infused and prednisone is taken orally night before and day of chemo. I finished in january and as mentioned above my psa dropped dramatically. I took psa test 5 weeks later and it climbed to 40 and approximately 1 week ago it was 60. I really never had a leveling out of psa but they say drug can work for many by stabilizing psa for up to 2 years. Just did not happen for me which seems to be the trend for me. The drug fortunately did not give me any real side effects. The prednisone kept me wired and up at night but no biggie. It did make me feel better because if it works it shuts down the cancer and in my case the bone mets subsided giving me more mobility. Hope this helps, Ken
Posts.Title: How much time did chemo buy you:
